Krhinos: Then we're off. Make them roar, Dracon! (He opens a channel
with the DockMaster) Station Arx Metallicus ready for departure. Open
the doors, would you?

Dockmaster: Self-centered youngsters... Never happy are ya? I'll open
the slaggin' doors, but ya better scram or I might close them on ya...

Krhinos said nothing back. He simply pressed an ignition key that made
the whole station shudder with a low rumble. The doors slowly opened
and the base started flying outward. Soon, it was passed the huge
gates and off into space.

Krhinos: Rukus, give me an estimateof the time we'll be travelling
before we're ok to warp.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "LurkerAbyss" <1641coburn@r...> wrote:
> Dracon acknowledges Krhinos' word.
> 
> "I'm on it Captain," he says as he makes his way to the engine and
control area.
> 
> After flicking around and double-checking the systems to  make sure
everything is in order, he smiles.
> 
> "We're good to go," he reports.
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: Nic 
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   Sent: Saturday, June 14, 2003 8:48 AM
>   Subject: Re: StarDrill Corp.
> 
> 
>   Krhinos: Thanks Rukus... (Helooks at the monitor) Dracon, the twenty
>   cycles are up! Engage the engines when you're ready!
> 
>   --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Jeff" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
>   > --Rukus--
>   > 
>   > Rukus grabbed the comm, "Good to go on your signal Krhinos. The
bird 
>   > shall fly." He preped the last of the timewarp engines, and engaged 
>   > the power drives. The panel lit up with an all green, and the
engine 
>   > began to glow and hum.
>   > 
>   > 
>   > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:

>   > > Krhinos: Is everything good? Are you all ready?
